definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: His old legs and shoulders pivoted with the swinging of the pulling.
sentences.chinese: 他一把把地拉着，两条老迈的腿儿和肩膀跟着转动。

sentences.english: So what does kill off the oldest old?
sentences.chinese: 那么是什么导致了老迈老人的死亡？

sentences.english: Just then an old man came and helped me. A few minutes later, he mended the bike well.
sentences.chinese: 这时一个老迈爷走过来帮我，几分钟后车修好了。

sentences.english: I hope I can do it before I’m too old.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我老迈之前能够回到那里。

sentences.english: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons as judges for Israel.
sentences.chinese: 撒母耳年纪老迈，就立他儿子作以色列的士师。

sentences.english: So Job died, being old and full of days.
sentences.chinese: 这样，约伯年纪老迈，日子满足而死。

sentences.english: With perhaps an older actress holding hands with a little one.
sentences.chinese: 又或许一名年纪老迈的女演员，与一名小演员挽着手。

sentences.english: Now Ahijah could not see, for his eyes were dim because of his age.
sentences.chinese: 亚希雅因年纪老迈，眼目发直，不能看见。

sentences.english: Well, an old stump is good for sitting and resting.
sentences.chinese: 一个老迈的大树墩正适合坐着休息。

sentences.english: But Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.
sentences.chinese: 亚希雅因年纪老迈，眼目发直，不能看见。

sentences.english: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
sentences.chinese: 我们这里有白发的，和年纪老迈的，比你父亲还老。

sentences.english: The French Bourbon dynasty is strong, even though Louis XIV is aging.
sentences.chinese: 尽管太阳王已经日显老迈，波旁王朝的根基仍然坚固。

sentences.english: Now Ahijah could not see; his sight was gone because of his age.
sentences.chinese: 亚希雅因年纪老迈，眼目发直，不能看见。

sentences.english: Return home, my daughters; I am too old to have another husband.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿们哪，回去吧，我年纪老迈，不能再有丈夫。

sentences.english: Now Israel's eyes were failing because of old age, and he could hardly see.
sentences.chinese: 以色列年纪老迈，眼睛昏花，不能看见。

definition: to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
elderly, as in movement or bearing
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
